titleStmt.title: A certaine and true relation of a great and glorious victory obtained by the Protestant party in Ireland, under the conduct of the Lord Inchequid, Sir Iohn Paulet and others. Against Rori Mac-Guire in the assistance of the Munster Rebels, and the O Carty, and other of the Irish, to the great advancement of the Protestant cause in that Kingdome, and debiliting the rebels forces: they having lost in the said battell at least foure thousand foot and horse, and besides six or seven hundred prisoners. This conflict and victory hapning neare Bandon Bridge in the county of Korke, the 23 of November. 1642.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
